channel.title: Cleaned Battlescape V1
channel.description:
http://www.mediafire.com/?aot1qbnztlzra12
I took this: http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/downloads/215311-cleaned-battlescape.html
Then I:
Packaged it Cleaned it some more Removed [b]all[/b] dead code (according to Eclipse) Remove all warnings (according to Eclipse) Added a text handler Added a menu handler Added a special handler Added a saving handler Added a loading handler Rearranged file formation Removed more useless crap icey missed Removed all commented out code Fixed Magic on Npcs Created a begginings to Constants.java
This is just the beginning as I clean this more and handle it better etc I will keep releasing.
Eventually it will meet my standards for a base and I will create a server, that or I will give up.

item.title: Cleaned Battlescape V1
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Zymus Lord Zymus
item.description:
@Lord_Zymus wrote:

Try this:

NIO
http://pastie.org/1122055

IO
http://pastie.org/1122059

Should work.

Note: When reading a new packet you have to do rsBuffer.updateBuffer(packetBytes) because doing:

buffer = new RSBuffer(); buffer.setISAACSeed(serverKey, clientKey); //read packet data into byte[] buffer = new RSBuffer(packetData);
removes the cipher data(should be obvious)

Read full topic

item.title: Cleaned Battlescape V1
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Download this, I got it fully added, but on log in it won’t fully log in. I am thinking it might be a problem with it creating the keys correctly for the log in to fully work. But I am not to sure.

MediaFire

RT317 CWRSBuffer.rar

MediaFire is a simple to use free service that lets you put all your photos, documents, music, and video in a single place so you can access them anywhere and share them everywhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Cleaned Battlescape V1
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Zymus Lord Zymus
item.description:
@Lord_Zymus wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:19, topic:357204”][quote author=Tatemo link=topic=453722.msg3323346#msg3323346 date=1282890073]
I think part of the problem is Blakeman not only renamed everything but rearranged the wording.

E.g
writeWordBigEndianA
Became
putLEsomethingthatreplacedwordA
[/quote]

I don’t think its that, I think its more a problem with us implementing it wrongly.

EDIT: It might also be a bug in RSBuffer not allowing us to get it to work correctly. I have yet to see a server use it fully.[/quote]

Do you know where i could find that? I’d have to take a look at it.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:

[quote=“Tatemo, post:18, topic:357204”]I think part of the problem is Blakeman not only renamed everything but rearranged the wording.

E.g
writeWordBigEndianA
Became
putLEsomethingthatreplacedwordA[/quote]

I don’t think its that, I think its more a problem with us implementing it wrongly.

EDIT: It might also be a bug in RSBuffer not allowing us to get it to work correctly. I have yet to see a server use it fully.

item.title: Cleaned Battlescape V1
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

RSBuffer is a class created by Blakeman8195 that is pretty much the Stream and Cryption classes in one, meaning you can encrypt and decrypt the data send from server to client and client to server, it is also much better, legal and has a lot better conventions then the regular Cryption and Stream classes.

Read full topic

Tons of people have tried but can’t seem to figure it out :P. tons of people add it to like 2 classes and then stop with out adding it fully. :P[/quote]

item.title: Cleaned Battlescape V1
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Zymus Lord Zymus
item.description:
@Lord_Zymus wrote:

Don’t forget to properly name the stream methods. ie. some of the little endian methods in stream were originally labeled as big endian.

Read full topic
